page.description: Numeric formatting options for cells containing numeric values.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::General]*
item.description: Value = 0. General Format.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::Number]*
item.description: Value = 1. General numeric format for example - 1000.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::NumberDecimal2]*
item.description: Value = 2. Number with a decimal point for example - 1000.00.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::NumberSeparated]*
item.description: Value = 3. Number with thousands separator for example - 100,000.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::NumberSeparatedDecimal2]*
item.description: Value = 4. Number with decimal point and thousands separator for example - 100,000,00.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::CurrencyNegativeBracketed]*
item.description: Value = 5. Monetary value, negative in brackets for example - (1000$).

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::CurrencyNegativeBracketedInRed]*
item.description: Value = 6. Monetary value, negative is in red brackets for example - (1000$).

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::CurrencyDec2NegBracketed]*
item.description: Value = 7. Monetary value with decimal point, negative in brackets for example - ($1000.00).

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::CurrencyDec2NegBracketedInRed]*
item.description: Value = 8. Monetary value with decimal point, negative in red brackets for example - ($1000.00).

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::Percent]*
item.description: Value = 9. Percent value, multiply the cell value by 100 for example - 75%.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::PercentDecimal2]*
item.description: Value = 10. Percent value with decimal point, multiply the cell value by 100 - for example 75.00%.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::ScientificDecimal2]*
item.description: Value = 11. Scientific value with E character and decimal point - for example 10.00E+1.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::Fraction1Digit]*
item.description: Value = 12. Fraction value, one digit - for example 10 1/2.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::Fraction2Digit]*
item.description: Value = 13. Fraction value, two digits - for example 10 23/95.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::Date]*
item.description: Value = 14. Date value, depends on OS settings - for example 3/11/2011.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::CustomDMonYY]*
item.description: Value = 15. Custom date format D-MON-YY - for example 11-Mar-09.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::CustomDMon]*
item.description: Value = 16. Custom date format D-MON - for example 11-Mar.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::CustomMonYY]*
item.description: Value = 17. Custom date format MON-YY - for example Mar-09.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::CustomHMMAM]*
item.description: Value = 18. Custom time format H:MM AM - for example 8:30 AM.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::CustomHMMSSAM]*
item.description: Value = 19. Custom time format H:MM:SS AM - for example 8:30:00 AM.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::CustomHMM]*
item.description: Value = 20. Custom time format H:MM - for example 8:30.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::CustomHMMSS]*
item.description: Value = 21. Custom time format H:MM:SS - for example 8:30:00.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::CustomMDYYYYHMM]*
item.description: Value = 22. Custom time format MDYYYY H:MM AM - for example 3/11/2009 8:30.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::NumberSepNegBracketed]*
item.description: Value = 37. Number with thousands separator, negative in brackets - for example (4,000).

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::NumberSepNegBracketedInRed]*
item.description: Value = 38. Number with thousands separator, negative in red brackets - for example (4,000).

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::NumberSepDec2NegBracketed]*
item.description: Value = 39. Number with thousands separator and decimal point, negative in brackets - for example (4,000.00).

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::NumberSepDec2NegBracketedInRed]*
item.description: Value = 40. Number with thousands separator and decimal point, negative in red brackets - for example (4,000.00).

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::Account]*
item.description: Value = 41. Account value - for example 5,000.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::AccountCurrency]*
item.description: Value = 42. Account value with currency symbol- for example $ 5,000.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::AccountDecimal2]*
item.description: Value = 43. Account value with decimal point - for example 5,000.00.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::AccountDecimal2Currency]*
item.description: Value = 44. Account value with currency symbol and decimal point - for example $ 5,000.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::CustomMMSS]*
item.description: Value = 45. Custom time format MM:SS - for example 30:55.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::CustomH0MMSS]*
item.description: Value = 46. Custom 24-hour time format H0:MM:SS - for example 20:30:55.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::CustomMMSS0]*
item.description: Value = 47. Custom time value MM:SS.0 - for example 30:55.0.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::Custom000P0E_PLUS0]*
item.description: Value = 48. Custom value 000.0E+0 - for example 152E+3.

item.name: *[xb:Office::NumericFormat::Text]*
item.description: Value = 49. Any text value.
